summary: REQ-1 is only partially addressed: frontend/index.html now includes a favicon <link>, but the actual favicon static asset under frontend/public was not added in the diff. Additionally, the diff includes substantial unrelated frontend feature work not requested by the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add favicon static asset(s) under frontend/public and reference them from the HTML entry point so browsers display the site icon (no missing favicon 404).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows no added files, and there is no evidence that the referenced favicon file exists under frontend/public. The HTML references '/assets/generated/favicon-ml-badge.dim_512x512.png', but no such file was added, so this likely results in a missing asset/404.

hallucinated_features.description: Large-scale frontend styling/theme changes (global CSS, Tailwind theme extensions) not related to adding a favicon.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks to add a favicon asset and reference it from the HTML entry point; styling/theme work is out of scope.

hallucinated_features.description: Significant new/modified application sections and features (marketing site sections, tracking, label printing, courier partners, contact submission hooks, WhatsApp query logging, validation utilities).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly limits scope to adding a favicon and states non-goals include changing booking/sender/receiver functionality; these changes appear unrelated to favicon setup.
